channel.title: Comments on: Master Data Services stops working after an upgrade
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Niels Grove-Rasmussen
item.dc:creator: Niels Grove-Rasmussen
item.description: Great post! It works fine also with MDS 2014 after SP1 upgrade. You just saved my day :-)
item.content:encoded:
Great post! It works fine also with MDS 2014 after SP1 upgrade.
You just saved my day ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Koen Verbeeck
item.dc:creator: Koen Verbeeck
item.description: Thanks Eric for sharing this info!

item.title: By: Eric
item.dc:creator: Eric
item.description: Koen, great post. I've hit this as well. A couple other things to be aware of. When you do the repair or upgrade you may lose customizations you have made within the MDS database. I had created a custom view, extending the base subscription view for an entity, the upgrade deleted this view. This is noted in the small print in the MDS on line documentation. Also if you have business rules you should validate the model after the upgrade. The upgrade appears to invalidate entity members.
item.content:encoded: Koen, great post. I’ve hit this as well. A couple other things to be aware of. When you do the repair or upgrade you may lose customizations you have made within the MDS database. I had created a custom view, extending the base subscription view for an entity, the upgrade deleted this view. This is noted in the small print in the MDS on line documentation. Also if you have business rules you should validate the model after the upgrade. The upgrade appears to invalidate entity members.
